Parallel Sort

Data Processing

Enterprise-grade log analysis and processing platform built on the FastMCP framework. Provides comprehensive log sorting, advanced analytics, pattern detection, anomaly detection, multi-condition filtering, and export capabilities. Features parallel processing for large files, temporal analysis, error clustering, and sophisticated statistical insights for scientific computing and system monitoring workflows.

1.0.0 Version
7 Actions
Jan 15 Updated
Python Language

Installation Methods

Global Installation

uv pip install scientific-mcps

Individual MCP Installation

uv pip install "scientific-mcps[parallel-sort]"

Direct Server

uv run mcp_parallel_sort

Claude Desktop Configuration

{ "mcpServers": { "parallel-sort": { "command": "uv", "args": ["run", "mcp_parallel_sort"] } } }

Available Actions

  • sort_log_by_timestamp
    Sort log file entries chronologically by timestamp with graceful handling of invalid entries
    Parameters: file_path (path to log file)
  • parallel_sort_large_file
    High-performance parallel processing for large files (>100MB) with configurable chunk sizes and worker processes
    Parameters: file_path (large log file), chunk_size_mb (optional, default 100), max_workers (optional, default CPU count)
  • analyze_log_statistics
    Comprehensive statistical analysis including temporal patterns, log level distribution, message analysis, and data quality metrics
    Parameters: file_path (log file)
  • detect_log_patterns
    Advanced pattern detection including error clustering, anomaly detection, trending issues, and temporal pattern analysis
    Parameters: file_path (log file), time_window_minutes (optional, default 5), min_cluster_size (optional, default 3)
  • filter_logs
    Multi-condition filtering with complex logical operations (AND, OR, NOT) and multiple operators (equals, contains, regex, between, etc.)
    Parameters: file_path (log file), filters (array of filter conditions), logical_operator (optional, default AND)
  • apply_preset_filter
    Apply predefined filters for common use cases: errors_only, warnings_and_errors, exclude_debug, connection_issues, authentication_events
    Parameters: file_path (log file), preset_name (filter preset to apply)
  • export_logs
    Export processed logs in multiple formats (JSON, CSV, plain text) with optional metadata and summary reports
    Parameters: file_path (log file), export_format (json|csv|txt), output_path (optional), include_metadata (optional, default false)

Usage Examples

Basic Log Processing

// Sort log files chronologically {"action": "sort_log_by_timestamp", "file_path": "system.log"} // High-performance processing for large files {"action": "parallel_sort_large_file", "file_path": "massive_logs.log", "chunk_size_mb": 200, "max_workers": 4}

Advanced Analytics and Pattern Detection

// Comprehensive statistical analysis {"action": "analyze_log_statistics", "file_path": "application.log"} // Detect anomalies and error clusters {"action": "detect_log_patterns", "file_path": "server.log", "time_window_minutes": 10, "min_cluster_size": 5} // Apply predefined filters {"action": "apply_preset_filter", "file_path": "debug.log", "preset_name": "errors_only"}

Complex Filtering and Export

// Multi-condition filtering {"action": "filter_logs", "file_path": "audit.log", "filters": [ {"field": "level", "operator": "in", "value": ["ERROR", "FATAL"]}, {"field": "timestamp", "operator": "between", "value": ["2024-01-01", "2024-01-31"]} ], "logical_operator": "AND"} // Export with metadata {"action": "export_logs", "file_path": "filtered_logs.log", "export_format": "json", "include_metadata": true}

Scientific Computing Workflows

// Process experimental data logs {"action": "sort_log_by_timestamp", "file_path": "experiment_run_001.log"} // Analyze computational job patterns {"action": "detect_log_patterns", "file_path": "hpc_jobs.log"} // Filter authentication events for security analysis {"action": "apply_preset_filter", "file_path": "cluster_access.log", "preset_name": "authentication_events"} // Statistical analysis of simulation outputs {"action": "analyze_log_statistics", "file_path": "simulation_results.log"}

System Monitoring Use Cases

// Monitor connection issues {"action": "apply_preset_filter", "file_path": "network.log", "preset_name": "connection_issues"} // Detect performance anomalies {"action": "detect_log_patterns", "file_path": "performance.log", "time_window_minutes": 15} // Export critical errors for incident response {"action": "filter_logs", "file_path": "critical_system.log", "filters": [{"field": "level", "operator": "equals", "value": "CRITICAL"}]} {"action": "export_logs", "file_path": "critical_filtered.log", "export_format": "csv"}

Performance & Technical Specifications

  • Architecture: Built on FastMCP framework with async processing
  • Parallel Processing: Automatic detection for files >100MB
  • Memory Optimization: Streaming processing with configurable chunk sizes (default 100MB)
  • Worker Management: Configurable processes (default: CPU count, max 8)
  • Log Format: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS LEVEL MESSAGE
  • Export Formats: JSON, CSV, Plain Text with optional metadata
  • Filter Presets: errors_only, warnings_and_errors, exclude_debug, connection_issues, authentication_events
  • Anomaly Detection: Statistical analysis for volume spikes and drops
  • Pattern Recognition: Error clustering, temporal analysis, trending issues
  • Transport Support: stdio and SSE transports
